main event: On October 6, 1957, in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, a flight of four round disc-like objects, orange-yellow in color, was observed. The objects followed a straight path and then vanished, with a length of observation of 3 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were observed to be under intelligent control, making rapid maneuvers, sharp turns, and hovering motionless at times.
Mrs. Elizabeth E. Klima reported an extraordinary light phenomenon in Bernardsville, New Jersey, which appeared larger than a full moon and emitted rays of light in all directions.
An article discussed the use of balloons by atmospheric researchers and military technicians to gather high-altitude information on speed and altitude.
The Potter family in South Lee, Massachusetts, reported a UFO landing and bright light illuminating their house, followed by a peculiar flattened pattern in the high grass in the area.
Five unidentified flying objects were sighted over Oahu, Hawaii, with the Navy and Air Force unable to determine their identity.
sighted object: four round disc-like objects, orange-yellow in color
location: Milwaukee, Wisconsin, Bernardsville, New Jersey, South Lee, Massachusetts, Oahu, Hawaii
witnesses: Mrs. Elizabeth E. Klima, the Potter family, multiple witnesses in Oahu, Hawaii
